DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value that is a grade for the Prothrombin time (seconds prolonged) or Prothrombin time INR measurement of the Child-Pugh Classification (CPC), used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation._Annotation used to indicate that the size or magnitude of something was determined by comparison to a standard._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.__A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: >6 Prothrombin time (seconds prolonged) or >2.3 Prothrombin time INR
4 - 6 Prothrombin time (seconds prolonged) or 1.7 - 2.3 Prothrombin time INR
<4 Prothrombin time (seconds prolonged) or <1.7 Prothrombin time INR

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.:A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.

A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prothrombin time (sec prolong
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prothrombin time (sec prolonged) or PT INR

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Nebraska adoption of C3D
